content.question: Assume a competitive firm is producing where price <math alttext="open parenthesis, P, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(P)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and marginal revenue <math alttext="open parenthesis, M R, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are greater than marginal cost <math alttext="open parenthesis, M C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>MC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and average variable cost <math alttext="open parenthesis, A V C, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>AVC</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is true regarding the firmâ€™s short-run output level?

choices.label: The firm is producing too little and should increase its output level until <math alttext="P equals M R, which equals M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P = </mtext><mtext>MR</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>MC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The firm is producing too much and should reduce its output level until <math alttext="P equals M R, which equals A V C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P = </mtext><mtext>MR</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>AVC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
The firm is not maximizing profits and should raise its price but not change its output level.

The firm should increase its marginal revenue to equal price and reduce its output level until <math alttext="M R equals M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MR = MC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The firm should reduce its price until <math alttext="P equals M R, which equals M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P = </mtext><mtext>MR</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>MC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The firm is producing too little and should increase its output level until <math alttext="P equals M R, which equals M C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P = </mtext><mtext>MR</mtext><mo>=</mo><mtext>MC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
